sentences.en: Baldry’s 20-year prison sentence was commuted to three years.
sentences.cn: 鲍德里二十年的刑期被减至三年。

sentences.en: Because you have to commute, you get the good car.
sentences.cn: 因为你的出去应酬, 所以你驾好车.

sentences.en: Get jobs in offices and wake up for the morning commute.
sentences.cn: 难道要找个工作,早上醒来就往办公室跑.

sentences.en: He seemed at times to be asking God to commute these penalties.
sentences.cn: 有时他好象还恳求上帝加以改造.
他打算乘长途车往返上下班。

sentences.en: I wonder how many people commute to work in this big city.
sentences.cn: 我不知道在这个城市里有多少人乘公交车上下班.

sentences.en: It's a long commute from New York to Boston.
sentences.cn: 从纽约通勤到波士顿路程很长.

sentences.en: Mary used to commute five miles from her home in the suburb.
sentences.cn: 玛丽过去每天从郊区的家里走五英里来上班.

sentences.en: Mike commutes to Miami every day.
sentences.cn: 迈克每天通勤去迈阿密。

sentences.en: Miners commute between the mines and their housing estates on weekdays.
sentences.cn: 矿工们在工作日每天乘火车上下班来往于矿区和住宅区之间.

sentences.en: Most office workers commute from the suburbs.
sentences.cn: 很多公司的职员都是从郊外来上班的.

sentences.en: So you're going to move back to your home and commute to school?
sentences.cn: 那你是想搬回家走读了?

sentences.en: The average Los Angeles commute is over 60 miles a day.
sentences.cn: 洛杉矶的平均上下班路程为每天60多英里。

sentences.en: The biggest change is to my morning and evening commute.
sentences.cn: 最大的变化在我早晚上下班上.

sentences.en: The components of the spin operator don't commute with each other.
sentences.cn: 自旋操作符的组件彼此间不能互换.

sentences.en: There is standing room only on the high - speed commute.
sentences.cn: 高速 往返的通勤路程中只有站立的空间.

sentences.en: We chose to live out of town and commute to work every day.
sentences.cn: 我们决意住在城外,每天赶路上班.

words.tran_cn: 可取代的；可交换的；可抵偿的
可代替；[物] 可对易性
减刑；交换；经常来往；代偿
通勤者，经常乘公共车辆往返者；[交] 月季票乘客
乘公交车上下班；经常往来
整流；变换电流方向；转换

trans.tran_en: A commute is the journey that you make when you commute
to regularly travel a long distance to get to work

trans.tran_cn: 坐车往返通勤；乘公交车上下班，经常乘车往返于两地
trans.tran_en: to regularly travel a long distance to get to work
to change the punishment given to a criminal to one that is less severe
